newsitem.title: ITALY: Illegal immigrant ship runs aground off Italy.
newsitem.headline: Illegal immigrant ship runs aground off Italy.

text.p: A Turkish-registered ship carrying more than 200 illegal immigrants ran aground off southern Italy on Thursday, police and coastguards said.

Police said they had apprehended around 210 people, including several women and children, who jumped overboard and swam ashore when the ship, identified by coastguards as the Vakfikebir, got into trouble in rough seas.
Most of those caught, who were expected to be served with expulsion orders, were Iraqi Kurds, police said. Pakistanis and Indians had also been on board.

The ship, which had set out from a Turkish port on May 23, send out a mayday signal as it ran aground just south of the city of Catanzaro on the heel of Italy. There was no sign of the crew when coastguards went aboard.
Southern Italy's long coast is a magnet for illegal immigrants, many of whom then make their way into northern Europe.
More than 15,000 Albanians landed on the southern Adriatic coast in March in a flotilla of decrepit boats after armed unrest broke out in the Balkan state.
